BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Index.HeaderTitle: Bootstrap style Blazor UI component library
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Index.HeaderDesc: Based on the Bootstrap style library, it is carefully built, and {0} a variety of commonly used components have been added to bring you an extraordinary feeling for rapid development projects
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Index.HeaderBody1: native Blazor components library on the market
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Index.CarouselP1: Provide a variety of commonly used chart components
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Index.CarouselP3: With all functions of adding, deleting, modifying, searching, paging, and sorting
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Index.ContainerD1: This set of components library contains more than {0} multiple components, from simple buttons to complex page-level components
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Index.ContainerD2: Each control has been fine-tuned to optimize the refresh logic between parent and child components to avoid multiple loop updates
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Index.ContainerD3: Easily grasp how to use components and quickly incorporate BootstrapBlazor controls into the project
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Index.ContainerD4: Simple, direct, free to use, no dependent components, dependent on jQuery Bootstrap are all built-in
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Index.ContainerD5: Detailed documentation and online demonstration, simple function setting, direct copy code out of the box
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Index.ContainerD6: Gitee platform hosting open source, never closed source, continuous update, timely response to questions and feedback
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Index.DonateH2: Scan the code to donate and invite the author to have a cup of coffee

BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Labels.P1: This set of components includes ValidateForm EditorForm and a variety of Form components inherited from ValidateBase<TValue>. Among these components There is a special set of display front label logic, now let’s sort it out in a unified way:
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Labels.UlLi1: The ValidateForm component is a verifiable form component. The form component in this component will automatically perform data compliance checks. If Data non-compliance will prevent the Submit action, which is the most frequently used component in data submission
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Labels.UlLi2: The EditorForm component is an ordinary form component. After this component is bound to the Model, the entire form can be automatically generated, which greatly reduces repetition Code, put the ValidateForm on the outside to open the data compliance check very convenient, concise and efficient

BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Labels.Tips: The logic of ShowLabel is the principle of proximity. The closer the setting is to itself, the setting takes effect. BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Table.Tab.Title: Table Row
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Table.Tab.Desc: Used to display multiple pieces of data with similar structures, data can be sorted, filtered, compared or other custom operations.
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Table.Tab.RowNubmerIntro: By setting the ShowLineNo property to true, the table displays the row number, the default value is false
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Table.Tab.RowNumberP: Set the LineNoText property value to set the line number column header display text, the default is line number
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Table.Tab.ClickToSelectTitle: Click the cell to select the entire row effect
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Table.Tab.ClickToSelectIntro: By setting the ClickToSelect property value, you can click any cell to select the entire row, and the selected row style is set to active
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Table.Tab.ClickToSelectP: You can set the OnClickRowCallback callback delegate method to handle the clicked row accordingly. After clicking any row in the table, the Name value of the bound data of the selected row will be displayed below
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Table.Tab.ClickToSelectP2: Note: UI rendering is not performed inside this callback delegate. When UI data update operation is required, please manually and explicitly call the StateHasChanged method
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Table.Tab.DoubleClickToEditIntro: By setting the DoubleClickToEdit attribute value, you can double-click any cell to edit the current row. This function is only available if the Edit function is available
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Table.Tab.DoubleClickToEditP: The mobile terminal (CardView) mode temporarily does not support double-click to edit the current row function
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Table.Tab.DoubleClickToEditP1: The multi-select mode also supports the double-click editing function. If you set the ClickToSelect click selection effect, the double-click editing function will cause the row selection state to be alternately selected. Please set ClickToSelect=false. Disable this feature
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Table.Tab.DoubleClickRowCallbackIntro: This function is only valid in the Table component single-selection mode. By setting the DoubleClickRowCallback attribute value, you can double-click any cell to customize the callback delegate method and realize your own the required function
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Table.Tab.DoubleClickRowCallbackP: The mobile terminal (CardView) mode temporarily does not support double-click editing of the current row function
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Table.Tab.SetRowClassFormatterIntro: By setting the SetRowClassFormatter attribute value, you can set the row style through the row data logic, and realize the function of your own highlighting requirements
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Table.Tab.SetRowClassFormatterP: In this example, the SetRowClassFormatter method will highlight the row by judging the Count > 60 of the bound data

BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Table.Tab.Title: Table Search
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Table.Tab.Desc: Commonly used for single table maintenance, simple addition, deletion, modification, search, sorting, filtering, search and other common functions can be realized through attribute configuration, and very complex can be realized through the advanced usage of Template business needs functions
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Table.Tab.SearchTableTips: The search function of the Table component provides two modes, which can be set through SearchMode. The default is Popup, which is the popup mode. In the Top mode, the search bar will be built into the top of the table. In this mode, the Refresh button and the Search button are combined into one, you can set the ShowSearchButton=false close the search button
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Table.Tab.SearchTableIntro: Set ShowSearch to display the query component, customize the search UI by setting the SearchTemplate template
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Table.Tab.SearchTableLi1: Enable no data display function by setting ShowEmpty="true"
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Table.Tab.SearchTableLi2: The EmptyText parameter is used to set the text to be displayed when there is no data, the default is to take the built-in text in the resource file
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Table.Tab.SearchTableLi3: EmptyTemplate parameter is used to customize no data display template
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Table.Tab.NamePlaceholder: Please enter your name within 50 characters
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Table.Tab.AddressPlaceholder: Please enter the address within 500 characters
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Table.Tab.AutoGenerateSearchIntro: When ShowSearch is set, if SearchTemplate is not set when editing template, the component will try to automatically generate search criteria UI
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Table.Tab.AutoGenerateSearchP: When the column information is bound, set the Searchable property and set the search criteria to automatically build the UI. You can set the SearchDialogShowMaximizeButton to maximize the search pop-up window display Maximize button
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Table.Tab.AutoGenerateSearchTips: When building a search popup window automatically, since each column is set to Searchable, the component will pass SearchText and set Searchable Each column whose value is true automatically builds a search lambda expression, which is obtained through the attribute Searchs of QueryPageOptions
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Table.Tab.CustomColSearchIntro: When SearchTemplate is set, the component automatically generates the search UI using this template as the rendering UI
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Table.Tab.CustomColSearchP: By setting the SearchTemplate of the name column to customize the edit, use the drop-down box to select the name
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Table.Tab.CustomColSearchP1: Because it is a search condition, in this example, the drop-down box of the name search column is added. Please select... item
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Table.Tab.CustomColSearchP2: The column search template is generated in the search order SearchTemplate -> AutoGenerate first to find out whether the search template is set, and then automatically generated according to the bound field type
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Table.Tab.CustomColSearchP3: Set the search bar to show only Advanced Search by setting ShowSearch="true" ShowSearchText="false"
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Table.Tab.CustomColSearchP4: Make the search popup draggable by setting SearchDialogDraggable="true"
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Table.Tab.CustomerSearchModelIntro: Set CustomerSearchModel and CustomerSearchTemplate to fully control the search criteria UI
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Table.Tab.CustomerSearchModelP: Due to a certain application scenario, our form entity class TItem is not ideal as a search model, for example, we have an attribute that is int or enum, we need a blank condition item of all or please select... as a search condition. It is very difficult to use the default model at this time , you can use the custom search model CustomerSearchModel and CustomerSearchTemplate to customize the control search interface

BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Table.Tab.Title: Filter and sort function
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Table.Tab.Desc: Filter to quickly find the data you want to see; sort to quickly find or compare data.
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Table.Tab.DescLi1: Filters a column of data to specify the column to be filtered by specifying the filterable property of the column
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Table.Tab.DescLi2: Sort a column of data, specify the column to be sorted by specifying the Sortable property of the column, change the collation by multiple clicks
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Table.Tab.FilterableIntro: Set the Filterable property of the TableColumn column to control whether the column header has data filtering enabled
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Table.Tab.FilterableLi1: The Filters in the query method parameters are filter criteria, and the database can filter the data by itself through this property when querying data
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Table.Tab.FilterableLi2: No sense of use, normal query data, no processing is done to filtering, internal processing will be carried out according to Filter
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Table.Tab.FilterableLi3: When external filtering has been made, set the Value of the IsFiltered property of the QueryData<TItem> parameter to true
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Table.Tab.FilterableLi4: Each column can be set separately, and the filter between columns is And and relationship
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Table.Tab.FilterableDiv: This example is of DateTime, string, bool, enum, int type, and the pop-up filter box is also different
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Table.Tab.FilterableAlert: To enable filtering, you only need to set the Filterable value of TableColumn to true, no additional code required
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Table.Tab.FilterTemplateIntro: Set FilterTemplate template values, customize column filter templates, very suitable for complex types of filter pop-ups
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Table.Tab.FilterTemplateP: The FilterTemplate type is RenderFragment: its value is a custom component, and the component must inherit the filterBase In this case, the last column in this case, the Quantity column, uses the custom component by filtering the template CustomerFilter [portal] CustomerFilter component source code
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Table.Tab.ShowFilterHeaderIntro: Show filter header when the ShowFilterHeader property value is set to true
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Table.Tab.DefaultSortIntro: Default sorts as default when setting the DefaultSort property value to true
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Table.Tab.DefaultSortLi1: Set DefaultSort=true to enable the default sort function, when multiple columns set this property, the first column works
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Table.Tab.DefaultSortP: In this case the default sort is the last column in reverse order
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Table.Tab.SortListIntro: Set the SortList property, use this parameter for multi-column sorting when the table loads
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Table.Tab.SortListP: The default collation in this case is: DeteTime desc Address, you don't need to handle the sort logic yourself, the component is already built-in
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Table.Tab.OnSortP: When clicking the column header to sort, the component calls the OnSort callback internally, where its return value can be set according to the business logic to achieve dynamic multi-column sorting, in this case, when clicking the time column header for positive order sorting, use DateTime,Count internally, useDateTime desc, Count descwhen Count reverse order
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Table.Tab.SetFilterInCodeIntro: Example shows how to set filters through code

BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Table.Tab.Title: Fixed header function
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Table.Tab.Desc: When scrolling data, the header is fixed to facilitate viewing the header information of each column
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Table.Tab.DescP:
The fixed header of this component adopts the double header method. When there is a common problem, the column is not aligned. Please add some styles according to your actual situation.
,Please set the width of each column as much as possible to avoid the problem of misalignment of column width
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Table.Tab.FixedHeaderP: Example of vertical scroll bar after more data is loaded
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Table.Tab.FixedHeaderP1: Please set a column width, allow a column width not set, auto-fill
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Table.Tab.FixedWidthIntro: Set the Height=200 fixed header, when the displayed data on each page is 10 rows, the height exceeds the set value 200, A vertical scroll bar appears on the Table component
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Table.Tab.FixedWidthP: All columns are set to width, and a horizontal scroll bar will automatically appear when the screen is too small
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Table.Tab.AllowResizingIntro: Set the AllowResizing property while fixing the header so that the column width can be adjusted
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Table.Tab.AllowResizingP:
By setting the Height parameter to fix the header,
, by setting AllowResizing , the parameter allows the column width to be adjusted
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Table.Tab.AutoHeightIntro: Do not set the Height value to adapt the height through the parent container
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Table.Tab.AutoHeightP: In this example, the Table table component cannot set the height because the height may not be known. The parent container may get the height through the style. At this time, the Table component will try to Use adaptive fill to fill the height, this application scenario is the most in actual combat, in this example, the simulated parent height is 300px
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Table.Tab.DialogDesc:
Tips for using theTable with a fixed header in the Dialog:

The Dialog should assign values to theClass parameter of DialogOption. In this example, it is set todialog-table. This operation is to enable us to customize the style to locate theTable component's parent container in the Dialog and set its height, Here you can use the writing method of adaptive height height: calc (100vh - 200px);; When the parent container of a Tablecomponent has a height, the component itself will perform adaptive height adaptation through calculation

BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Introductio.Title: Introduction
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Introductio.P1: BootstrapBlazor is an enterprise-level component library based on Bootstrap and Blazor, which can be considered as the Blazor version of the Bootstrap project.
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Introductio.P3: In the latest Project Template ,the above dependencies are packaged and bundled, which greatly simplifies use
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Introductio.UpdateLog: In order to fix the components bugs, a small version of the component may be released every day. The second Thursday every month release official version
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Introductio.LearnLi2: Use Blazor WebAssembly and Visual Studio Code to generate web applications
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Introductio.P5: The largest code hosting collaborative development platform in China Gitee C# The highest star in the sector Works Universal background management system BootstrapAdmin Ready to use this component to achieve all functions
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Introductio.P6: The Bootstrap Blazor UI component library provides everything from basic Button components to advanced web-level SmartPage components
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Introductio.AdvantageLi1: No need to write Javascript to use components
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Pages.Introductio.AdvantageLi3: The component supports two-way data binding

BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Reconnect.Title: Reconnector
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Reconnect.SubTitle: Reflect the connection state in the UI (Blazor Server)
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Reconnect.Intro: The following table describes the CSS classes applied to the components-reconnect-modal element by the Blazor framework.
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Reconnect.TableRow1: A lost connection. The client is attempting to reconnect. Show the modal.
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Reconnect.TableRow2: An active connection is re-established to the server. Hide the modal.
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Reconnect.TableRow3: Reconnection failed, probably due to a network failure. To attempt reconnection, call window.Blazor.reconnect() in JavaScript.
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Reconnect.TableRow4: Reconnection rejected. The server was reached but refused the connection, and the user's state on the server is lost. To reload the app, call location.reload() in JavaScript. This connection state may result when:
BootstrapBlazor.Shared.Samples.Reconnect.TableRow5:
• A crash in the server-side circuit occurs.
  • The client is disconnected long enough for the server to drop the user's state. Instances of the user's components are disposed.
  • The server is restarted, or the app's worker process is recycled.
